THREAD: @HouseDemocrats are working on an interim #COVID19 relief bill to provide additional support our health care system & American families, before moving to pass an additional CARES 2 package. 
 
We’re calling for:

$3 million in additional funding from #CARESAct has arrived to support 4th District Community Health Centers. CHCs are the backbone of our health system and these funds are critical during the #COVID19 crisis, but Congress must provide more CHC funding in the next relief package. https://t.co/vwbe5MbLgi

The first #CARESAct included $400M to help states with voting-by-mail. What’s happening in Wisconsin today puts people’s lives at risk, and is a prime example of why more investment is urgently needed to protect both voters & the integrity of our 2020 election.
The $2.2 trillion #CARESAct demands oversight and a tough, independent watchdog to ensure every tax dollar is saving lives and jobs and protecting American families.

People experiencing domestic violence already face challenges – and shelter-in-place orders, which are extremely important to stop the spread of #COVID19, can make a bad situation worse. It’s past time for the Senate to pass #VAWA4ALL and expand protections for survivors. https://t.co/W22wuuhX75

On #WorldHealthDay, this year’s theme (appropriately) is support for nurses & midwives. With our words & our actions, let’s thank these and all the health workers who are on the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/kVHQ96KlwJ

Thanks to @HouseDemocrats’ insistence that tribal nations be included in #COVID19 emergency relief, MN tribes have received $5.9 million from @HUDgov in Indian Housing Block Grants for housing development, operations, safety activities & more for Native American families in need.

MN just received an additional $2.6 million to help combat the #COVID19 crisis, for a total of $13 million received so far from @CDCgov. This is just one slice of the federal emergency relief funds coming into our state to help hospitals & medical facilities care for Minnesotans.

The #CARESAct includes help for people with federal student loan debt: payments & interest are automatically suspended for six months (though you can continue making payments if you choose to) due to the #COVID19 crisis.
